Google Developer Group Sri Lanka

GDG Sri Lanka is a community of enthusiasts and developers who are interested in Google technologies.

Learn more

WHAT IS GOOGLE DEVELOPER GROUP(GDG)

Something you should not miss out!
Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google’s developer technology; everything from the Android, Chrome, Drive, and Google Cloud platforms, to product APIs like the Cast API,Maps API, and YouTube API. A GDG can take many forms — from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers.

VISION / What we Intend

With the world becoming smarter and connected and technology being more sophisticated, computing technology is the latest buzz word which is set to play a defining role in the future. Computing Technology are expected to change the way we live our lives. We encourage and invite Technology Enthusiasts/ Developers/Designers /Interested Students/Professionals to be a part of this awesome community of like minded personalities and come up with innovative and futuristic product ideas, that is set to re-define the digital culture and people’s lives.

Meetups

GDG Sri Lanka is planning to continue its monthly meetups soon...

G-College

G-College is a project initiated by GDG SL for the benefit of less IT literate students in the rural areas of the country.

CodeLanka

CodeLanka is an initiative to share knowledge on coding to less IT literate students in Sri Lanka by the use of tutorials and video lessons.

Events which we did

Here are some of our events

Google IO 2015 Extended Sri Lanka

Google IO 2015 Extended was the latest event of the three extended events done in Sri Lanka parallel with the Google IO in San Francisco. The participation in this event was more than 2000 enthusiasts. It was at Trace expert city, Maradana.

Android Jam Workshops

Done with the help of Google Student Ambassadors and WSO2 Inc., the Android Jam was a series of tutorial session which aided students of several universities to develop an android application hands-on.

DevFest 2014 Sri Lanka

The second DevFest to be held in Sri Lanka was held at Park Street Mews.

Android App Clinic 2014
